intro: [WRONG START] Genista baeticia var. pumila, commonly known as the dwarf Genista, is a low-growing shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It features small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has slender, wiry stems and small, leathery leaves that are typically green with a slight bluish tinge. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a ground cover. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental horticulture.
